dc_title_s: Part of the map of Mexico prepared by J. Disturnell and published in New York in 1847
dc_description_s: Published in: Boundaries, areas, geographic centers and altitudes of the United States and the several states / Edward M. Douglas. Washington : Government Printing Office, 1923. Geological Survey Bulletin 689.; Relief shown by hachures.; Prime meridian: Washington.; "Bulletin 669, Plate IV."; "A photographic reproduction of the part of the map referred to in the treaty of Guadalupe-Hidalgo of 1848 ... ."; Includes text.; Includes southwestern USA and northwestern Mexico.|38 x 51 centimeters|Scale [1:4,435,200] 70 miles to 1 inch|General Map Collection
